title: This Giant Bow Is the Perfect Coquette Holiday Decor
description: It’s so on trend for Bow Girl Christmas. READ MORE...
author: Isabel Petrou
excerpt: It’s so on trend for Bow Girl Christmas.
text: Home ProjectsDIYsDecor & AccessoriesWe independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.Credit: Madison ReneeBetween the live-action Barbie movie coming out last summer, Glinda wearing all things pink in the upcoming Wicked movie, and coquette decor in general having a moment, I feel like people are embracing pink and bows more than ever. No wonder I’m spotting cute pink Christmas ideas everywhere I look!And one perfect example of coquette holiday decor is this DIY giant bow, courtesy of TikToker Geneva Vanderzeil. All you need to make this supercute item is a pillow, a pillowcase, and a sheet in any color you love, plus some fabric glue (or a sewing kit if that’s your vibe). You could easily thrift these materials if you don’t want to ruin your own. The best part is that the finished product can easily be hung up in your dorm or on your dorm door!Not to mention, the process looks totally doable. First, put your pillow into the pillowcase. (You may need to take some fluff out of your pillow before this.) Next, squeeze your pillow together in the center and tie two smaller strips of your sheet around it to make a bow shape. Then cut a big, thick strip of your sheet and glue (or sew) it together along the inside edges. After that, cut the ends on a diagonal, turn the whole thing inside out, and glue or sew those ends shut. Do that thick strip part again. Iron these bow tails and attach them to the center of the bow. Next, cut another wide piece of your sheet, fold over the edges so they look clean, and wrap the strip around the center of the bow. You can also make a little hanger for your bow using some extra fabric — perfect for a Command strip or similar removable hook. And there you have it: This big, cute bow can adorably hang on your door or any wall in your dorm!
html:
• Home Projects
  • DIYs
  • Decor & Accessories

We independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.

Between the live-action Barbie movie coming out last summer, Glinda wearing all things pink in the upcoming Wicked movie, and coquette decor in general having a moment, I feel like people are embracing pink and bows more than ever. No wonder I’m spotting cute pink Christmas ideas everywhere I look!

And one perfect example of coquette holiday decor is this DIY giant bow, courtesy of TikToker Geneva Vanderzeil. All you need to make this supercute item is a pillow, a pillowcase, and a sheet in any color you love, plus some fabric glue (or a sewing kit if that’s your vibe). You could easily thrift these materials if you don’t want to ruin your own. The best part is that the finished product can easily be hung up in your dorm or on your dorm door!

Not to mention, the process looks totally doable. First, put your pillow into the pillowcase. (You may need to take some fluff out of your pillow before this.) Next, squeeze your pillow together in the center and tie two smaller strips of your sheet around it to make a bow shape. Then cut a big, thick strip of your sheet and glue (or sew) it together along the inside edges. After that, cut the ends on a diagonal, turn the whole thing inside out, and glue or sew those ends shut. Do that thick strip part again. Iron these bow tails and attach them to the center of the bow. Next, cut another wide piece of your sheet, fold over the edges so they look clean, and wrap the strip around the center of the bow. 

You can also make a little hanger for your bow using some extra fabric — perfect for a Command strip or similar removable hook. And there you have it: This big, cute bow can adorably hang on your door or any wall in your dorm!
